xml.spreadsheet

Class XMLSpreadsheetGenerator

  • java.lang.Object
    • xml.spreadsheet.XMLSpreadsheetGenerator

  • public class XMLSpreadsheetGenerator
extends java.lang.Object
    Partial implementation of the spreadsheet format described in the article
    Microsoft XML Spreadsheet Reference
    The generator will follow this state machine:
    Constructor -> [Create style]* -> startDocument -> [openSheet -> [column]* -> [openRow -> [openCell -> closeCell]* -> closeRow]* -> closeSheet ]* -> closeDocument
    The Generator will throw a XMLSpreadsheetException if the API user tries to break the state machine (say for example, try to write a cell after closing the document, or writing a row before opening a sheet)

      • startRow

        public void startRow(java.lang.String caption,
            java.lang.Boolean autoFitHeight,
            java.lang.Double height,
            java.lang.Boolean hidden,
            Style style)
              throws XMLSpreadsheetException
        Begins a row. Sets the WRITING_ROW state.
        Parameters:
        caption - Specifies the caption that should appear when the component's custom row and column headers are showing
        autoFitHeight - f this attribute is True, it means that this row should be autosized
        height - Specifies the height of a row in points. This value must be greater than or equal to 0
        hidden - True specifies that this row is hidden. False (or omitted) specifies that this row is shown
        style - Style object to be applied to this row
        Throws:
        XMLSpreadsheetException - If called in an inappropiate state or any other library-related exception arises

                    throws XMLSpreadsheetException
        Writes a single empty <ss:Row> element with the desired span and formatting
        Parameters:
        emptyRows - Number of empty rows to write with this method
        autoFitHeight - f this attribute is True, it means that this row should be autosized
        height - Specifies the height of a row in points. This value must be greater than or equal to 0
        style - Style object to be applied to these rows
        Throws:
        XMLSpreadsheetException - If called in an inappropiate state or any other library-related exception arises

      • closeRow

        public void closeRow()
              throws XMLSpreadsheetException
        Streams the ending of a row. Sets the WRITING_SHEET state. If we have created no cells in the row, it will flush nothing to the output, but increase the counter for the next row.
        Throws:
        XMLSpreadsheetException - If called in an inappropiate state or any other library-related exception arises

        Throws:
        XMLSpreadsheetException - If called in an inappropiate state or any other library-related exception arises

      • column

        public void column(java.lang.String caption,
          java.lang.Boolean autoFitWidth,
          java.lang.Boolean hidden,
          java.lang.Long index,
          java.lang.Long span,
          Style style,
          java.lang.Double width)
            throws XMLSpreadsheetException
        Defines the formatting for one or more adjacent columns. This element contains no data; all cell data is stored within Row elements. All Column elements must appear before the first Row element.
        Parameters:
        caption - (optional) Specifies the caption that should appear when the Component's custom row and column headers are showing
        autoFitWidth - (optional) If this attribute is specified as True, it means that this column should be autosized for numeric and date values only. We do not autofit textual values.
        If both ss:Width and ss:AutoFitWidth exist, the behavior is as follows:
        ss:AutoFitWidth="1" and ss:Width is unspecified: Autofit the column width to fit the content.
        ss:AutoFitWidth="1" and ss:Width is specified: Set the column to the specified width and only autofit if the size of the content is larger than the specified width.
        ss:AutoFitWidth="0" and ss:Width is unspecified: Use the default column width.
        ss:AutoFitWidth="0" and ss:Width is specified: Use the specified width.
        hidden - (optional) True specifies that this column is hidden. False (or omitted) specifies that this column is shown
        index - (optional) Specifies the position of this column within the table.
        If this tag is not specified, the first instance has an assumed Index="1". Each additional Column element has an assumed Index that is one higher.
        Indices must appear in strictly increasing order. Failure to do so will result in an XML Spreadsheet document that is invalid. Indices do not need to be sequential, however. Omitted indices are formatted with the default style's format.
        Indices must not overlap. If duplicates exist, the behavior is unspecified and the XML Spreadsheet document is considered invalid. An easy way to create overlap is through careless use of the Span attribute. 1 <= Index <= Total columns
        span - (optional) Specifies the number of adjacent columns with the same formatting as this column. When a Span attribute is used, the spanned column elements are not written out.
        As mentioned in the Index tag, columns must not overlap. Doing so results in an XML Spreadsheet document that is invalid. Care must be taken with this attribute to ensure that the span does not include another column index that is specified. This value follows the rules of the span attribute in HTML rather than the specified in the documentation, so a value of 'X' will mean a total number of X columns with the specified style, width, etc., counting the first one
        style - (optional) Specifies a reference to a previously defined Style. This reference indicates that this Style should be used to format this element. If this attribute is not present, the default Style should be applied to this element.
        width - (optional) Specifies the width of a column in points. This value must be greater than or equal to 0.
        Throws:
        XMLSpreadsheetException - If called in an inappropiate state or any other library-related exception arises

      • column

        public void column(Style style,
          java.lang.Double width)
            throws XMLSpreadsheetException
        Defines the formatting for one or more adjacent columns. This element contains no data; all cell data is stored within Row elements. All Column elements must appear before the first Row element. This method tries to give a useful shortcut for the (hopefuly) more often used options.
        Parameters:
        style - (optional) Specifies a reference to a previously defined Style. This reference indicates that this Style should be used to format this element. If this attribute is not present, the default Style should be applied to this element.
        width - (optional) Specifies the width of a column in points. This value must be greater than or equal to 0.
        Throws:
        XMLSpreadsheetException - If called in an inappropiate state or any other library-related exception arises

      • writeCell

        public void writeCell(Style style,
             java.util.Date value)
               throws XMLSpreadsheetException
        Writes a date to a cell
        Parameters:
        style - Style object to apply to the cell. Remember that the proper way to create a date format is to create a Style object, and then define for it a proper NumberFormat.
        value - Date value to write
        Throws:
        XMLSpreadsheetException - If called in an inappropiate state or any other library-related exception arises
        See Also:
        Custom date formatting

      • writeCell

        public void writeCell(java.util.Date value)
               throws XMLSpreadsheetException
        Writes a date to a cell. It will print it with the standard format of the library (yyyy-MM-dd)
        Parameters:
        value - Date value to write
        Throws:
        XMLSpreadsheetException - If called in an inappropiate state or any other library-related exception arises
